New analysis of satellite images shows Haiti has lost almost all of its original forest as NPR's Dan Charles reports researchers say the country's deforestation could be complete within Twenty years
The researchers say deforestation in Haiti is driven by poverty peasant farmers cut down trees to turn the wood into charcoal which they can sell Thirty years ago about four and a half percent of Haiti's lab mostly on mountainsides was covered with true native forest
